title: Bruno Tonioli replaced again on Strictly Come Dancing by Alfonso Ribeiro

Bruno Tonioli is missing out on next week's Strictly Come Dancing - and will be replaced by a very familiar face again.

The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air star Alfonso Ribeiro, also known as Carlton Banks, will be sitting in for Bruno for the second year running.

Bruno, who also judges the US version of the show, Dancing With The Stars, has to miss the British show once again because of prior commitments.

He usually has to fly out of London to Los Angeles as soon as filming wraps on the BBC One show every Saturday night.

Strictly fans loved Alfonso's appearance last year and impressed bosses have invited him back on the judging panel again.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

A spokesperson for Strictly told Mirror Online: "The quest for the Glitterball trophy continues as Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman host the fifth live Strictly Come Dancing show.

"Thirteen celebrity couples remain in the race to be crowned Strictly Come Dancing champion 2019.

"Each of them will take to the floor in a bid to impress the awesome foursome judges Craig Revel Horwood, Shirley Ballas, Motsi Mabuse and returning guest judge Alfonso Ribeiro, in the studio, as well as viewers at home.

"The two couples with the lowest combined scores from the judges and votes from the public must then dance for survival on Sunday’s results show."

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

(Image: Getty)

This is not the first time that Bruno was forced to miss a show because of his hectic schedule.

Back in 2017 he was forced to skip his first episode in the series' 16 year history because his work schedule was through the roof.

Bosses decided not to replace Bruno and there were only three judges on the panel that week.

(Image: BBC)

Last year, Bruno had to miss out yet again but was replaced by Alfonso for the first time.

Alfonso busted some moves during a very jazzy entrance into the Strictly studio alongside fellow judges Craig Revel Horwood, Darcey Bussell and Shirley Ballas.

When asked what his judging would be like, he said: "I'm a glass half full kind of guy. I want to see the fun."

*Strictly Come Dancing airs on Saturday on BBC One at 6.40pm
description: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air star will be sitting in for Bruno for the second year running after impressing bosses
